unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Gas Tanks
question_text: A study was done to examine gas tank size (in gallons) and miles driven.  Twenty-nine people were randomly chosen, had their gas tanks filled, and then were asked to drive their cars until empty.  The following summary data was collected: Predictor Coef SE Coef T P Constant $148.6$ $1.256$ $4.05$ $0.0000$ Gas tank $11.56$ $1.769$ $5.11$ $0.0000$ Assuming all conditions have been verified, construct a $95\%$ confidence interval for the slope and write an interpretation of your results.

choices.text: We are 95 % 95 % confident that the interval from 146.02 146.02 to 151.18 151.18 miles per gallon captures the true slope of the regression relating gas tank size and miles driven.
We are 95 % 95 % confident that the mean of the interval from 7.54 7.54 to 15.58 15.58 miles per gallon captures the true slope of the regression relating gas tank size and miles driven.
We are 95 % 95 % confident that the interval from 7.54 7.54 to 15.58 15.58 miles per gallon captures the true slope of the regression relating gas tank size and miles driven.
We are 95 % 95 % confident that the mean of the interval from 7.93 7.93 to 15.19 15.19 miles per gallon captures the true slope of the regression relating gas tank size and miles driven.
We are 95 % 95 % confident that the interval from 7.93 7.93 to 15.19 15.19 miles per gallon captures the true slope of the regression relating gas tank size and miles driven.
